text: if I were a rich man tidal diddled Idol
digga digga diesel by the a good lyric
usually is a combination of an emotion
or a thought that's been well expressed
with some freshness of language in
Fiddler on the Roof my job was to
provide the lyrics last year was our
50th anniversary fiddler has been
successful for all these years for
several reasons it's just a good show
the story is about how our protagonist
deals with those very painful changes we
identify with that in a very human way
lyric writing is the art of substitution
in a way it's like doing a crossword
puzzle you have a thought but it doesn't
fit the music and constantly it's a way
of using other words with other meters
to fit that music about the state of
theater I'm very optimistic there are a
number of young composers and lyricists
who are just first-rate about my own
career have always been pessimistic but
at the start of any new project I always
think I wonder if I can do it again
